article.title: ONE CLASSROOM, MANY NATIONS; AS THE CHILDREN OF IMMIGRANTS AND REFUGEES FROM ALL OVER THE WORLD ENTER SCHOOLS HERE IN RISING NUMBERS, THE COST OF HELPING THEM LEARN ENGLISH IS INCREASING BY ABOUT $1 MILLION A YEAR IN MINNEAPOLIS AND IN ST. PAUL SCHOOLS.IN ST. PAUL, NEARLY ONE STUDENT IN FOUR IS ENROLLED IN A LIMITED ENGLISH PROFICIENCY PROGRAM. THAT'S A TOTAL OF 9,465 STUDENTS, AND THE DISTRICT SAYS SEVERAL THOUSAND MORE COULD USE HELP.
